rocks.bastion.core

Class GeneralRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • rocks.bastion.core.GeneralRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpRequest

    public class GeneralRequest
extends Object
implements HttpRequest
    An HTTP request which takes any arbitrary text string as its content body. The GeneralRequest will not perform any conversions or validation on any user-supplied body content. Use the static factory methods, such as get(String) or post(String, String) to initialise a new GeneralRequest.

    By default, this request will contain no headers (except for the content-type) and no query parameters. Use the addHeader(String, String) and addQueryParam(String, String)} to add them. Also, initially, the request will have the "text/plain" content-type MIME (which is automatically added to the HTTP headers by Bastion): you can change this content-type by calling the setContentType(ContentType) method.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static GeneralRequest get(String url)
        Construct an HTTP request, using the GET method, to be sent on the specified URL. It will also have a descriptive name which is generated by combining the HTTP method with the URL. Use the addQueryParam(String, String) to add query parameters to the request.
        Parameters:
        url - A non-null URL to send the request on
        Returns:
        An HTTP request using the GET method

      • post

        public static GeneralRequest post(String url,
                                  String body)
        Construct an HTTP request, using the POST method, to be sent on the specified URL and with the specified content body. The request will initially be sent with a content-type of "text/plain". It will also have a descriptive name which is generated by combining the HTTP method with the URL. If you would like to send some other representation of content body then we suggest using some other implementation of HttpRequest.
        Parameters:
        url - A non-null URL to send the request on
        body - A non-null string to use as body content. Pass in the EMPTY_BODY constant if you don't want to send a body
        Returns:
        An HTTP request using the POST method

If you would like to send some other representation of content body then we suggest using some other implementation of HttpRequest.

      • withMethod

        public static GeneralRequest withMethod(HttpMethod method,
                                        String url,
                                        String body)
        Construct an HTTP request, using the specified HTTP method, to be sent on the specified URL and with the specified content body. The request will initially be sent with a content-type of "text/plain". It will also have a descriptive name which is generated by combining the HTTP method with the URL. If you would like to send some other representation of content body then we suggest using some other implementation of HttpRequest.
        Parameters:
        method - A non-null HTTP method to send within the request
        url - A non-null URL to send the request on
        body - A non-null string to use as body content. Pass in the EMPTY_BODY constant if you don't want to send a body
        Returns:
        An HTTP request

      • addRouteParam

        public GeneralRequest addRouteParam(String name,
                                    String value)
        Add a new HTTP route parameter that will be sent with this request. Put a placeholder for the route parameter in the request URL by surrounding a parameter's name using braces (eg. http://sushi.test/{id}/ingredients). The URL in the previous example contains one route param which can be replaced with a numerical value using addRouteParam("id", "53"), for example.
        Parameters:
        name - A non-null name for the new route parameter
        value - A non-null value for the new route parameter
        Returns:
        This request (for method chaining)

      • setBody

        public GeneralRequest setBody(String body)
        Sets the body content that will be sent by this request. You cannot set the body to null; instead, if you don't want to send any body content, pass in the EMPTY_BODY constant.
        Parameters:
        body - A non-null string to send as the body content
        Returns:
        This request (for method chaining)

      • setTimeout

        public GeneralRequest setTimeout(long timeout)
        Sets the timeout, in milliseconds, that will cause the test to fail if no response response is received within the specified timeout. A value of 0 indicates no timeout; the test will wait indefinitely for a response.
        Returns:
        a number (in milliseconds) representing this requests's timeout

      • contentType

        public Optional<org.apache.http.entity.ContentType> contentType()
        Description copied from interface: HttpRequest
        The content type header to use for this request. This includes the MIME type of the content body, an optional character set of the request and other parameters, if necessary (such as quality parameter).
        Specified by:
        contentType in interface HttpRequest
        Returns:
        An optional content type to use for this request. Return an empty Optional if you would like to leave the content-type header undefined for this request.

      • headers

        public Collection<ApiHeader> headers()
        Description copied from interface: HttpRequest
        A collection of HTTP headers that will be included with this request. Note that Bastion will automatically include the "Content-type" header using the value returned by HttpRequest.contentType() if, and only if, the collection returned by this method does not contain a header for "Content-type." This means that this method should not return a "Content-type" header as part of the collection unless you want to override the content-type returned by the HttpRequest.contentType() method.
        Specified by:
        headers in interface HttpRequest
        Returns:
        A non-null collection of HTTP header to include with the request

      • queryParams

        public Collection<ApiQueryParam> queryParams()
        Description copied from interface: HttpRequest
        A collection of HTTP query parameters that will be used for performing this request. Query parameters are typically appended to the end of an URL following a question mark symbol.
        Specified by:
        queryParams in interface HttpRequest
        Returns:
        A non-null collection of query parameters for this request

      • routeParams

        public Collection<RouteParam> routeParams()
        Description copied from interface: HttpRequest

        A collection of route parameter assignments that will be replaced in the URL. For example, the following URL:

        http://sushi.test/{id}/ingredients

        The URL above contains one route parameter called "id" which can be assigned a numerical value which will be replaced when the actual HTTP takes place.

        Specified by:
        routeParams in interface HttpRequest
        Returns:
        A non-null collection of route parameters for this request.

      • body

        public Object body()
        Description copied from interface: HttpRequest
        An object that will serve as a content body for this request. Can be null if this request will not send a body. Bastion may use the content-type of this request, returned by the HttpRequest.contentType() method, as well as the runtime type of the object returned by this method to determine how best to serialize the returned object into the HTTP request's body.
        Specified by:
        body in interface HttpRequest
        Returns:
        An object that will serve as the content body for this request. May be null.

      • timeout

        public long timeout()
        Description copied from interface: HttpRequest
        A timeout (in milliseconds) that will cause tests to cutoff if:
        • the connection takes too long to be established
        • the response takes too long to arrive.
        Note that these are 2 separate timeouts; the test might take (in the worst case) twice the value of the timeout, if the phases mentioned above take long enough. Tests exceeding these timeouts will throw an AssertionError and be marked as failed. A value of 0 indicates no timeout - the test will wait indefinitely for a response. By default, this returns the HttpRequest.USE_GLOBAL_TIMEOUT constant, which indicates that the globally configured timeout should be used.
        Specified by:
        timeout in interface HttpRequest
        Returns:
        a number (in milliseconds) representing the longest a test should wait for each phase of a request
